719140f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - 8th Avenue (Southwest).
719140f-a.text:
Columbus Circle (West 59th Street) at the S.W. corner of Eighth Avenue (left). Across the roofs of these low structures appears a portion of the building at the N.W. corner of 58th Street housing "Reisenweber's,a famous rendezvous.
About 1900
Gift of Urbrock Collection

719141f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Broadway - 8th Avenue.
719141f-a.text:
Columbus Circle, south side, west from and including Broadway to and including Eighth Ave. Also shown is Broadway, east side, south from but not including West 59th Street.  Included is Eight Ave., east side, south from and including Columbus Circle.  The Columbus Monument is seen in the foreground where men are working on excavation for the I.R.T. Subway.

About 1900.

William B. Parsons Collection.

NEG#3805
719141f-a.folder: Columbus Circle & Broadway & 8th Avenue., Manhattan, NY

713983f-a.text:
333-335 West 58th Street, north side, between Eighth and Ninth
Avenues.
1912.

719131f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - 8th Avenue - Broadway.
719131f-a.text:
Columbus Circle, west side, north from but not including Eighth Ave, to and including Broadway. Also shown is West 59th Street, north side, west from and including Columbus Circle.

About 1918.

William Henry.

Neg. 2420
719131f-a.folder: Columbus Circle & 8th Avenue & Broadway., Manhattan, NY

713985f-a.text:
58th Street, north side, from Ninth to Eighth Avenues, showing also Ninth Avenue, east side, from 58th to 59th Streets.

June, 1925.

Neg # 4111

719130f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Broadway - 8th Avenue.
719130f-a.text:
Columbus Circle, south side, west from and including Broadway, to, but not including Eighth Ave. The view also shows Broadway, east side, north from but not including West 55th to West 59th Streets, and a1so Eighth Ave, east side, north from but not including West 56th Street, to and including Columbus Circle.

About 1924.

Ewing Galloway.
719130f-a.folder: Columbus Circle & Broadway & 8th Avenue., Manhattan, NY

731230f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, No. 1-3.
731230f-a.text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No. 1. At Columbus Circle: An alligator balloon, one of those which are regularly designed by Tony Sarg is hovering over the crowd and leering hungrily at some of the spectators. The camera points north on Broadway from Columbus Circle.
November 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 2. Another view; the camera is facing north on Central Park West.
November 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 3. Another view of the alligator.
November 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
731230f-a.folder: Broadway and Columbus Circle and Central Park West, Manhattan, N.Y.

731238f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.
731238f-a.text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No. 1. A balloon representing a chicken, held down close to the street, at Columbus Circle.
The view is south on Eighth Avenue.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 2. The dachshund of this year, with Macy's red star on his left side. Columbus Circle; the view is south at Eighth Avenue.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 3. A fat man in a bathing suit. The view is southwest.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
731238f-a.folder: Columbus Circle and 8th Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.

731239f-c.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.
731239f-c.text:
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No. 4, at Columbus Circle, showing the giant lying on his face. The view is south, on
the west side of Eighth Avenue.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

No. 5, at Columbus Circle, showing the hippopotamus in full harness. This view is also south.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

No. 6. The pig balloon.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Speer.

731240f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.
731240f-a.text:
Celebrations, Parades, & Municipal Events:

Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No.7, at Columbus Circle. A large rooster is turning into Eighth Avenue.

November 30, 1933.

P.L.Sperr
731240f-a.folder: Columbus Circle and 8th Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.

713982f-a.text:
W. 58th Street, north side, west of No. 315 (right, the first brownstone house) a point to the west of Eighth Avenue. West of the Ninth Avenue Elevated Line is Roosevelt Hospital. View No. 2 is west from No. 325 while No. 3 is eastward from
No. 345.

September 4, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3

P. L. Sperr

719106f-a.text:
Columbus Circle, Manhattan.
Corner of Central Park South.

General Photographic Co., Inc.

719106f-a.folder: Columbus Circle & [Central Park South.], Manhattan, NY

719142f-b.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Broadway - 8th Avenue.
719142f-b.text:
(1)
Columbus Circle, east side, west from and including Broadway to and including Eighth Ave. This view also shows Eighth Ave, east side, south from and including Columbus Circle, (West 59th Street,) to and including West 58th Street.
September 19, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.
(2)
Columbus Circle, W.59th Street, Broadway and Eighth Avenue,showing where these avenues meet, at the south western corner of Central Park. The statue of Columbus was erected by the Italians resident in America,and presented on the 12th of October,1892,the fourth centenary
of the discovery of America.
Copy right 1893.

J.S.Johnston and Co. Photographers,
Neu York City.
719142f-b.folder: Columbus Circle & Broadway & 8th Avenue., Manhattan, NY
